properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 40 are expected for the next 4 days. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-17T18:38:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T02:38:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1919973709.2020
Area: City of Toronto
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly wind gusts near 100 km/h are occurring this morning and may continue until this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T00:28:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T08:29:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4081151676.2020
Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected for the next 2 days. Temperatures are expected to reach near 30 degrees today and Saturday. Humidex values will likely reach the mid to upper thirties both afternoons. Temperatures overnight will remain in the upper teens to near twenty degrees, providing little relief from the heat. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Somewhat cooler and less humid air will arrive on Sunday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T00:41:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T08:42:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3412715228.2020
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: zero to +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: most of central and northeastern Newfoundland. Time span: early Friday morning and early Saturday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-17T16:52:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T00:53:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3025789609.2020
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid tropical air mass will begin to affect Southwestern Ontario today. The heat and humidity will last through the weekend to at least Monday. Afternoon temperatures will reach the low to mid thirties. Humidex values will reach the low forties each afternoon. Temperatures overnight will remain in the low to mid twenties, providing little relief from the heat. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Slightly cooler and less humid conditions may arrive on Tuesday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T00:38:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T08:39:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0657642391.2020
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid tropical air mass will begin to affect Toronto today. The heat and humidity will last through the weekend to at least Monday. Afternoon temperatures will reach the low to mid thirties. Humidex values will reach 40 each afternoon as well. Temperatures overnight will remain in the low to mid twenties, providing little relief from the heat. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Slightly cooler and less humid conditions may arrive on Tuesday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: zero to +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: most of central, northeastern, and eastern Newfoundland. Time span: early Saturday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
